meanings.definition: A foul-smelling diamine compound found in decaying flesh.
meanings.sent1: The cadaverine emitted a strong, unpleasant odor from the decaying body.
meanings.sent2: The forensic scientist identified the presence of cadaverine in the decomposing corpse.
meanings.sent3: The detective wrinkled his nose at the overwhelming stench of cadaverine in the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: The air was thick with the putrid scent of cadaverine, signaling the presence of death.
meanings.sent5: The cadaverine smell lingered in the room, haunting everyone who entered.

meanings.definition: A chemical compound with the formula NH2(CH2)5NH2, produced by the breakdown of amino acids in dead bodies.
meanings.sent1: The scientist detected high levels of cadaverine in the tissue samples from the deceased.
meanings.sent2: Cadaverine is a key indicator used in forensic investigations to determine time of death.
meanings.sent3: The lab technician joked that the cadaverine levels were so high, they could almost see the ghost of the deceased.
meanings.sent4: The presence of cadaverine in the soil around the grave served as a grim reminder of the body buried below.
meanings.sent5: The smell of cadaverine permeated the room, creating an eerie atmosphere of death.
